11. dispectore A word found only in patristic latin3 ‘observet' = omnium speculator below. It recurs ad uxor. ii. 8 ; de test. an. 2.

13. nec plenae nec adeo timendae. This criticism is perfectly just ; see Pressense iv. 369 ff. The highest standard of Pagan morality, as exhibited in the Stoicism of Seneca, was impetent in results. Heathen ethies neither penetrated to the conscience and soul nor inspired dread in those who despised them; they were neither com- plete nor sanctioned by penalties ; and their failure is a fact witnessed to by the historians and satirists of the empire. Comp. J uven. i. 147 ff.; Clem. Alex. Paed. iii. 3; Cyprian. Ep. 1 ad Donat. On Christian doctrine as the great motive to Christian aetion see Mozley's Bampt.
